author: Suntan
title: ooh, cute pandas!
review:
21158 the panda nursery is a very nice set with good minifigures and creatures. I think the build was made more for a display piece with lots of open space to play around in like of sets from the Minecraft line.

 

Minifigures and mobs

The only minifigure in the set is the regular Alex, which is a nice inclusion in a smaller set. The ocelot is a nice build with a very nice molded head with printing. It is nice to see the creature in a cheap set as well. The pandas are where the set really shines. You get one baby and one adult panda. I think the baby is the perfect sized panda as I feel like it fits more in minifigure scale. The normal/adult panda is nice too, but I think the body is a little too chunky as when you put the head on, the head looks very small. Overall, all figures in the set are very nice complete models.

 

The Build

The build in the set is very nice with the total dimensions being 24x12 studs. i think the stone home/base is nice, but it feels empty. i think a crafting table or a furnace would make it look better and more complete as a home in th Minecraft world. The bamboo is a nice build as well, the use of the 1x1 in sand yellow gives it a more Minecraft feel than if the designers just used bright yellowish green. The use of the new 2x4 jumper tile is very nice although I would've used it in a brick yellow. Overall the build is a very nice play and display piece for any LEGO Minecraft fan.

Conclusion

21158 the panda nursery is a very nice play and display piece with an excellent minifigure choice. I'd rate the set an A- because i think it would've been nice to see some printing on the tiles of the mobs.
